intro: Ammannia wormskioldii, commonly known as the redroot dayflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Ammannia wormskioldii is a member of the Commelinaceae family, known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
